byline.original: By JONATHAN SOBLE and PAUL MOZUR
byline.contributor: Jonathan Soble reported from Nagoya, Japan, and Paul Mozur from Hong Kong. Makiko Inoue and Hisako Ueno contributed research from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: The company plans to decide in the next month between competing offers from Foxconn of Taiwan and an investment fund financed by the Japanese government.

headline.print_headline: Sharp Leans Toward Bid by Foxconn of Taiwan
headline.main: In Industry Shift, Sharp Looks Outside Japan for a Buyer

snippet: The company plans to decide in the next month between competing offers from Foxconn of Taiwan and an investment fund financed by the Japanese government.
abstract: Sharp says it is favoring takeover bid by Foxconn of Taiwan, which assembles Apple iPhones and other products; deal could test Japan's reputation for fending off foreign buyouts, and challenges its plan to buy up unprofitable operations at domestic technology firms.
